questions.answer: Great Expectations with Strange Case of Dr Jekyll and Mr Hyde

questions.clue: This Scottish inventor improved the steam engine in the 1760s, making it more efficient and commercially viable.
First patented in 1876, this invention by Alexander Graham Bell revolutionized communication.
In 1903, these bicycle mechanics from Dayton, Ohio, achieved the first powered, sustained flight.
Created in 1973 by Martin Cooper at Motorola, this device was the first handheld portable communication tool.
In 1928, Scottish inventor John Logie Baird managed the first successful broadcast of this early color video technology.

categories.name: Melodies & Harmonies: The Science of Music

questions.clue: This term describes the speed or pace of a musical piece.
This scale is characterized by its seven pitches, including a half step between the third and fourth notes.
This term refers to the quality of sound that makes one instrument or voice sound different from another, even when they play the same note.
This branch of science studies the physical basis of sound including its production, transmission, and effects.
The overtone series is a sequence of notes that are higher in pitch than the fundamental, produced by this phenomenon.

final.clue: Opened in 1937, this landmark was named after a U.S. president and revolutionized transportation between Marin County and the San Francisco Peninsula.
final.answer: What is the Golden Gate Bridge?
